warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Rotate shoulders forward in a circular motion for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Clasp hands behind back and gently straighten arms, hold for 30 seconds. Then, clasp hands in front of chest and gently pull, hold for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Raise one arm overhead and bend at the elbow, placing hand behind the head. Use the other hand to gently pull the elbow closer to the head, hold for 30 seconds. Repeat on the other side.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet together, arms at sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Jump, spreading legs and raising arms overhead. Return to starting position.
Perform light cardio such as jogging in place or jumping jacks for 1 minute to increase heart rate and blood flow.

exercises.setup: Adjust the machine seat so that your back is comfortably supported.  Grab the handles with a slightly wider than shoulder-width grip. Ensure your feet are flat on the floor.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit comfortably on the machine with your back firmly against the backrest. Grab the handles, ensuring a secure grip.
2. The Press: Extend your arms fully, pushing the handles away from your chest. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement.
3. Controlled Descent: Slowly bring the handles back towards your chest, feeling a deep stretch in your pectoral muscles. Avoid letting the weight slam against your chest.
4. Full Range of Motion: Ensure a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the top and bringing the handles close to your chest at the bottom.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, with an overhand grip.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie supine on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Lowering the Bar: Slowly lower the barbell to your chest, keeping your elbows slightly flared out. Touch your chest with the bar.
3. Pressing Upward: Push the barbell back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully but avoiding locking your elbows.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion, avoiding any jerky movements.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on squeezing your chest at the top of the movement.  Maintain a stable position to enhance mind-muscle connection.

exercises.setup: Adjust the bench to an incline of approximately 30-45 degrees. Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the incline bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, positioned just above your chest.
2. Lowering the Dumbbells: Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping your elbows slightly flared out. Touch your chest with the dumbbells.
3. Pressing Upward: Push the dumbbells back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully but avoiding locking your elbows.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion, avoiding any jerky movements.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Adjust the cable machine to a height that allows you to sit comfortably.  Grab the handles and sit down, ensuring your back is straight.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit comfortably on the machine with your back straight. Grab the handles and extend your arms in front of you.
2. Fly Movement: Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, slowly bring the handles out to the sides, feeling a stretch in your chest.  Squeeze your chest at the end of the movement.
3. Controlled Return: Slowly bring the handles back to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.
4. Full Range of Motion: Ensure a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the start and bringing the handles out to the sides until you feel a good stretch in your chest.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on the mind-muscle connection, feeling the stretch and contraction in your chest muscles.

exercises.setup: Sit on the cable machine with your back straight. Adjust the cable height to a comfortable level. Grab the handles with a neutral grip.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit with your back straight and feet flat on the floor. Grab the handles and extend your arms in front of you.
2. Fly Movement: Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, slowly bring the handles out to the sides, feeling a stretch in your chest.  Squeeze your chest at the end of the movement.
3. Controlled Return: Slowly bring the handles back to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.
4. Full Range of Motion: Ensure a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the start and bringing the handles out to the sides until you feel a good stretch in your chest.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.
2. Fly Movement: Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, slowly bring the dumbbells out to the sides, feeling a stretch in your chest.  Squeeze your chest at the end of the movement.
3. Controlled Return: Slowly bring the dumbbells back to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.
4. Full Range of Motion: Ensure a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the start and bringing the dumbbells out to the sides until you feel a good stretch in your chest.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on the mind-muscle connection, feeling the stretch and contraction in your chest muscles.

exercises.setup: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell at shoulder height with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell at shoulder height with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Press Upward: Press the barbell straight overhead, fully extending your arms. Keep your core engaged and your back straight.
3. Controlled Descent: Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.
4. Full Range of Motion: Ensure a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the top and lowering the bar to shoulder height at the bottom.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Avoid arching your back. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement.

exercises.setup: Position the cable at a low setting and use a bar attachment. Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms fully extended overhead, holding the bar attachment.
2. Extension: Keeping your upper arms stationary, bend your elbows, lowering the bar behind your head. Focus on controlled movement.
3. Full Extension: Extend your elbows fully, returning to the starting position.  Squeeze your triceps at the top of the movement.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion, avoiding any jerky movements.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
2. Lowering the Bar: Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead, keeping your elbows tucked in.  The bar should arc behind your head.
3. Pressing Upward: Push the barbell back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully but avoiding locking your elbows.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion, avoiding any jerky movements.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement. Keep your upper arms stationary throughout the exercise.

exercises.setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a close, overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie supine on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a close, overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
2. Lowering the Bar: Slowly lower the barbell to your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in. Touch your chest with the bar.
3. Pressing Upward: Push the barbell back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully but avoiding locking your elbows.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion, avoiding any jerky movements.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Attach a straight bar to the cable machine's low pulley. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the straight bar with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
2. Lowering the Bar: Keeping your upper arms close to your sides, extend your arms fully, lowering the bar. Focus on controlled movement.
3. Full Extension: Extend your elbows fully, returning to the starting position.  Squeeze your triceps at the top of the movement.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the entire range of motion, avoiding any jerky movements.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement. Keep your upper arms close to your sides throughout the exercise.
